Q8_followup: The policy suggests that targeted genetic testing should be considered if the clinical presentation is consistent with a well-described genetic syndrome for which targeted genetic testing is available.
Q17: The policy requires submission of genetic testing documentation including the name of the genetic test, performing laboratory, date of sample collection, relevant billing codes, a brief description of how the test results will guide clinical decisions, and clinical documentation that the risks of testing have been discussed.

Submit the claim with the appropriate CPT code (81415) and ensure that the patient's clinical information, including the medical necessity criteria, is documented. Genetic counseling documentation should also be included as it is required by the policy.

The policy requires submission of the following information for review prior to the genetic testing: name of genetic test(s) and/or panel test, the exact gene(s) and/or variants being tested, name of performing laboratory and/or genetic testing organization, relevant billing codes, date of sample collection/blood draw, brief description of how the genetic test results will guide clinical decisions, and clinical documentation by the provider of family history and supporting rationale for the requested test(s).

Q8_followup: Testing restricted to the known familial mutation or comprehensive genetic testing if the specific familial mutation is unknown.
Q17: The policy requires precertification and genetic counseling prior to testing. The test must be ordered by a specialist or provider type approved by the policy. The claim should include documentation of medical necessity and any relevant family history or clinical indications.
